utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Man, I sure miss Julie.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Spanish midgets. Spanish midgets wrestling. Julie. Ok, yes, I see how you got there.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You ever figure out what that thing's for?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, see, I'm trying this new screening thing. You know, I figure if I'm always answering the phone, people'll think I don't have a life. My god, Rodrigo never gets pinned.

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Hello, I'm looking for Bob. This is Jane. I don't know if you're still at this number, but I was just thinking about us, and how great it was, and, well, I know it's been three years, but, I was kinda hoping we could hook up again. I barely had t he nerve to make this call, so you know what I did?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: I got a little drunk...and naked.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Bob here.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What've you been up to?

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Oh, you know, the usual, teaching aerobics, partying way too much. Oh, and in case you were wondering, those are my legs on the new James Bond poster.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Can you hold on a moment? I have another call. I love her.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I'm back.

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: So, are we gonna get together or what?

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Great, I'll see you then.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok. Ok. Having a phone has finally paid off.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Even though you do do a good Bob impression, I'm thinkin' when she sees you tomorow, she's probably gonna realize, "hey, you're not Bob."

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I'm hoping that when Bob doesn't show up, she will seek comfort in the open arms of the wry stranger at the next table.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh my god. You are pure evil.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok, pure evil, horny and alone. I've done this.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, everybody's here. Hey, everybody, say hi to Julie in New Mexico.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Hi, Julie!

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hi, Julie.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok, while Ross is on the phone, everybody owes me 62 bucks for his birthday.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Um, is, is there any chance that you're rounding up? You know, like from, like 20?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, come on, we got the gift, the concert, and the cake.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Do we need a cake?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Look guys, I know it's a little steep.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah, whoosh!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: But it's Ross.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: It's Ross.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I'll see you guys later, I gotta go...do a thing.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, sweetheart, I'll call you later tonight. Whoa, whoa, whoa, hey, hey, hey, you're not really gonna go through with this, are you?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You know, I think I might just.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: So uh, what are you guys doing for dinner tonight?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well I guess I gotta start savin' up for Ross's birthday, so I guess I'll just stay home and eat dust bunnies.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Can you believe how much this is gonna cost?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Do you guys ever get the feeling that um, Chandler and those guys just don't get that we don't make as much money as they do?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yes! Yeah, it's like they're always saying "let's go here, let's go there". Like we can afford to go here and there.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yes, yes, and it's, and we always have to go to, you know, someplace nice, you know? God, and it's not like we can say anything about it, 'cause, like this birthday thing, it's for Ross.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: For Ross.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: For Ross, Ross, Ross.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh my god.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I'm at work, ordinary day, you know, chop chop chop, sauti, sauti, sauti. All of a sudden, Leon, the manager, calls me into his office. It turns out they fired the head lunch chef, and guess who got the job.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: If it's not you, this is a horrible story.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Fortunately, it is me. And, they made me head of purchasing, thank you very much. Anyway, I just ran into Ross and Chandler downstairs, and they think we should go out and celebrate. You know, someplace nice.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'm tellin' you. You can't do this.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, come on. I can never get a girl like that with conventional methods.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That doesn't matter. She wanted to call Bob. Hey, for all we know, Bob is who she was meant to be with. You may be destroying two people's chance for happiness.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: We don't know Bob, ok? We know me. We like me. Please let me be happy.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Go over there and tell that woman the truth.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Listen, I have to, uh, um, I have to, I have to confess something.

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Whoever stood you up is a jerk.

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: How did you--?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I don't know. I just had this weird sense. You know, but that's me. I'm weird and sensitive. Tissue?

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, you keep the pack. I'm all cried out today.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, ok, here is to my sister, the newly-appointed head lunch chef--

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Who is also in charge of purchasing.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Newly appointed head lunch chef who is also in charge of purchasing--

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Who has her own little desk when Roland's not there.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh, lunch chef, purchasing, own little desk when Roland's not there. Here's to my little sister--

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, wait, and I got a beeper!

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Let's see!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That's fine, I'll just wait!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Sorry, sorry.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Monica!

utterance.speaker: WAITER
utterance.content: Are we ready to order?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, you know what, we haven't even looked yet.

utterance.speaker: WAITER
utterance.content: Well, when you do, just let me know. I'll be right over there on the edge of my seat.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Wow, look at these prices.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah, these are pretty ch-ching.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: What are these, like famous chickens?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey, sorry I'm late. Congratulations, Mon. I'm not sorry I'm late. How incredible was my afternoon with Jade?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, pretty incredible according to the message she left you on my machine. Hey, Chandler, why is this woman leaving a message for you on my machine?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, see, I had to tell her that my number was your number, because I couldn't tell her that my number was my number because she thinks that my number is Bob's number.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey, tell me again, what do I do when Mr. Roper calls?

utterance.speaker: WAITER
utterance.content: Do I dare ask?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yes, I will start with the carpaccio, and then I'll have the grilled prawns.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That sounds great. Same for me.

utterance.speaker: WAITER
utterance.content: And for the gentleman?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, I'll have the Thai chicken pizza. But, hey, look, if I get it without the nuts and leeks and stuff, is it cheaper?

utterance.speaker: WAITER
utterance.content: You'd think, wouldn't you? Miss?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, I will have the uh, side salad.

utterance.speaker: WAITER
utterance.content: And what will that be on the side of?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Uh, I don't know. Why don't you put it right here next to my water?

utterance.speaker: WAITER
utterance.content: And for you?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Um, I'm gonna have a cup of the cucumber soup, and, um, take care.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I will have the uh, Cajun catfish.

utterance.speaker: WAITER
utterance.content: Anything else?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes, how 'bout a verse of Killing Me Softly. You're gonna sneeze on my fish, aren't you?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Plus tip, divided by six. Ok, everyone owes 28 bucks.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Um, everyone?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, you're right, I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Monica's big night, she shouldn't pay.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, thank you!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: So five of us is, $33.50 apiece.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, huh uh, no way, I'm sorry, not gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, prom night flashback.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Monica, I'm really happy you got promoted, but cold cucumber mush for thirty-something bucks? No! Rachel just had that, that, that salad, and, and Joey with his like teeny pizza! It's just...

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, Pheebs! How 'bout we'll each just pay for what we had. It's no big deal.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Not for you.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: All right, what's goin' on?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, look you guys, I really don't want to get into this right now. I think it'll just make everyone uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Fine. All right, fine.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: You can tell us.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hello, it's us, all right? It'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ok, um, uh, we three feel like, that uh, sometimes you guys don't get that uh, we don't have as much money as you.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I hear ya.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: We can talk about that.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Well, then...Let's.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I, I just never think of money as an issue.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: That's 'cause you have it.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That's a good point.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So um, how come you guys haven't talked about this before?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: 'Cause it's always somethin', you know, like Monica's new job, or the whole Ross's birthday hoopla.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Wha--? Whoa, hey, I don't want my birthday to be the source of any kind of negative--there's gonna be a hoopla?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Basically, there's the thing, and then there's the stuff after the thing.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: If it makes anybody feel better, then we can just forget the thing, and we'll just do the gift.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: G-gift? The thing's not the gift?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No, the thing was, we were gonna go see Hootie and the Blowfish.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hootie and the--oh my. I, I can catch them on the radio.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, now I feel bad. You wanna go to the concert.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No, look, hey, it's my birthday, and the important thing is that we all be together.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: All of us.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Together.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Not at the concert.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So, the ebola virus. That's gotta suck, huh?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Gee, Monica, what's in the bag?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I don't know, Chandler. Let's take a look.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, it's like a skit.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Why, it's dinner for six. 5 steaks, and an eggplant for Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Whoo!

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah, we switched meat suppliers at work, and the new guys gave me the steaks as sort of a thank-you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: But wait, there's more. Hey, Chandler, what is in the envelope?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: By the way, this didn't seem so dorky in the hall.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Why, it's six tickets to Hootie and the Blowfish! The Blowfish!

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: It's on us, all right, so don't worry. It's our treat.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: So...Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Could you be less enthused?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Look, it's a nice gesture, it is. But it just feels like--

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Like?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Charity.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Charity?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: We're just tryin' to do a nice thing here.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ross, you have to understand that your nice thing makes us feel this big.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Actually, it makes us feel that big.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I don't, I don't understand. I mean, you, it's like we can't win with you guys.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: If you guys feel this big, maybe that's not our fault. Maybe that's just how you feel.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh, now you're tellin' us how you feel.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, we never shoulda talked about this.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm just gonna pass on the concert, 'cause I'm just not in a very Hootie place right now.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Me neither.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Guys, we bought the tickets.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, well, then you'll have extra seats, you know, for all your tiaras and stuff.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Why did you look at me when you said that?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, I guess now we can't go.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What? Come on, you do what you want to do. Do we always have to do everything together?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You know what? You're right.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: All right. We're gonna go. It's not for another six hours. We're gonna go then.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Chandler!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Geez! Are you ready?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah. Just let me grab my jacket and tell you I had sex today.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Whoa! You had sex today?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Wow, it sounds even cooler when somebody else says it. I was awesome, ok? She was biting her lip to stop from screaming.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Now I know it's been awhile, but I took it as a good sign.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Still doing the screening thing?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I had sex today. I never have to answer that phone again.

utterance.speaker: MACHINE
utterance.content: Here comes the beep, you know what to do.

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Hey, Bob, it's Jade. Listen, I just wanted to tell you that I was really hurt when you didn't show up the other day, and just so you know, I ended up meeting a guy.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Bob here.

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Oh, hi.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So, uh, you met someone, huh?

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Yes, yes, I did. In fact, I had sex with him 2 hours ago.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So, uh, how was he?

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Eh.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Eh?

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Oh, Bob, he was nothing compared to you. I had to bite my lip to keep from screaming your name.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, that makes me feel so good.

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: It was just so awkward and bumpy.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Bumpy?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, maybe he had some kind of uh, new, cool style, that you're not familiar with. And uh maybe you have to get used to it.

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Well there really wasn't much time to get used to it, you know what I mean?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You know what? I'm not gonna be able to enjoy this.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, I know, it's my birthday. We all should be here.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So, let's go.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well maybe, you know, maybe we should stay for one song.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean, it would be rude to them for us to leave now.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You know, the guys are probably having a great time.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Come on you guys, one more time.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok. One.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Nooo.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: That was amazing!

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Excellent, that was excellent.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I can't believe the guys missed this.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What guys? Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: Excuse me, you're Monica Geller aren't you?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Do I know you?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: You used to be my babysitter.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh my god, little Stevie Fisher? How've you been?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: Good, good, I'm a lawyer now.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You can't be a lawyer. You're eight.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: Listen, it was nice to see you. I gotta run backstage.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Uh, wait, backstage?

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, my firm represents the band.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ross.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Chandler.

utterance.speaker: STEVE
utterance.content: How are you? Look, you guys wanna meet the group? Come on. So, are you one of the ones who fooled around with my dad?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey, you guys.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Happy birthday.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, thank you, thanks. So uh, how was your night last night?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, well, it pretty much sucked. How was yours?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah, ours pretty much sucked, oh, but, I did run into little Stevie Fisher. Remember him?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh yeah. I used to babysit him. Hey, how's his dad?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Uh, good.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Uh, aside from that, the whole evening was pretty much a bust.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, we really missed you guys.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, look, we were just saying, this whole thing is really stupid.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: We just have to really, really, really, not let stuff like money get--is that a hickey?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No, I just, I fell down.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: On someone's lips? Where'd you get the hickey?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You know, a party, or--

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What party?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: It wasn't so much a party as...a gathering of people, with food, and music, and, and the band.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: You partied with Hootie and the Blowfish?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes, apparently Stevie and the band are like this.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Who gave you that hickey?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: That would be the work of a Blowfish.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh! I can't believe it. I can't believe this. We're just like, sitting at home, trying to guess Joey's fingers, and you guys are out like partying and having fun, and you know, all, "hey, Blowfish, suck on my neck".

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Look, don't blame us. You guys coulda been there, you know.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What, as part of your poor friends outreach program?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: It's work.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I don't know what to say. I'm sorry that we make more money than you. But we're not gonna feel guilty about it. We work really hard for it.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: And we don't work hard?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah, hi, it's Monica. I just got a page.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I'm just saying that sometimes we like to do stuff that costs a little more.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: And you feel like we hold you back.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Leon, Leon. Shhh! Guys. Wait, I don't understand. Those steaks were just a gift from the meat vendor. That was not a kick back. I'll just replace them and we can forget the whole thing. What corporate policy? No. Yeah. All right. I just got fired.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: WAITRESS
utterance.content: Here's your check. That'll be $4.12.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Let me get that. You got five bucks?

utterance.speaker: MACHINE
utterance.content: Here comes the beep, you know what to do.

utterance.speaker: JADE
utterance.content: Hi, it's me. Listen, Bob. I'm probably way out of line here. I mean, It has been 3 years, and you're probably seeing someone else now, but if we could just have one night together, just for old time's sake, one hot, steamy, wild night...
